sections.title: Syntax
sections.raw_content:
An indexType is one of:

  (a) subrangeType
  (b) enumeratedType
  (c) namedType   % Which is a subrange or enumerated type
  (d) char
  (e) boolean
sections.text_content:
An indexType is one of:
 (a)subrangeType (b)enumeratedType (c)namedType % Which is a subrange or enumerated type (d)char (e)boolean
sections.mdown_content:
An _indexType_ is one of:   
-  _subrangeType_   
-  _enumeratedType_   
-  _namedType_   _% Which is a subrange or enumerated type_   
-  **char**   
-  **boolean**

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: An index type defines a range of values that can be used as an array subscript, as a case selector, as a selector (tag) for a union type, or as the base type of a set type.
sections.text_content: An index type defines a range of values that can be used as an array subscript, as a case selector, as a selector (tag) for a union type, or as the base type of a set type.
sections.mdown_content: An index type defines a range of values that can be used as an **array** subscript, as a case selector, as a selector (tag) for a **union** type, or as the base type of a **set** type.

sections.title: Example
code:
var z : array 1 .. 9 of real    % 0..9 is an index type
        type smallSet : set of 0 .. 2   % 0..2 is an index type
